ch.ecma.csta.snapshot

Interface SnapshotServices


  • public interface SnapshotServices
    A set of services that allow an application to query for all calls on a device (snapshotDevice), or to query for all devices on a call (snapshotCall).

    Prerequisites Before attempting to use SnapshotServices, do the following:

    1. Acquire an instance of ServiceProvider by using the ServiceProvider.getServiceProvider method.
    2. Acquire an instance of SnapshotServices by using the ServiceProvider.getService method.

      3. Note that not all of the requests and for these services may be supported. In these cases, the request description will state that it is not supported.
      Similarly, not all of the parameters may be supported for a given request, or for any associated events. In these cases, the description of the request (or event) will contain a table of the parameters that are supported.

      Also note that both of the SnapshotServices requests are also available through AsynchronousServices.sendRequest. Consider using this service when you would like to not block your application while waiting for the response.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.3 $
    Author:
    AVAYA, Inc.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SnapshotCallResponse snapshotCall(SnapshotCall request)
      Provides information about the devices participating in a specified call.
      SnapshotDeviceResponse snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice request)
      Provides information about calls associated with a given device.

    • Method Detail

      • snapshotCall

        SnapshotCallResponse snapshotCall(SnapshotCall request)
                           throws CstaException
        Provides information about the devices participating in a specified call. The information provided includes device identifiers, their connections in the call, and local connection states of the devices in the call as well as call related information. The ConnectionID should be discovered using SnapshotDevice. The following code example shows how to use SnapshotCall. 

         SnapshotCall snapCall = new SnapshotCall();
 // snapConn is a ConnectionID that was retrieved using snapshotDevice
 snapCall.setSnapshotObject(snapConn);
 SnapshotCallResponse snapResp = service.snapshotCall(snapCall);
               
 SnapshotCallResponseInfo [] info = 
         snapResp.getCrossRefIDorSnapshotCallData().
         getSnapshotCallData().getSnapshotCallResponseInfo();
         
 for (int i = 0; i < info.length; i++) {
     SubjectDeviceID subj = info[i].getDeviceOnCall();
     System.out.println("Device is " + subj.getDeviceIdentifier().getContent());
     ConnectionID conn = info[i].getCallIdentifier();
     System.out.println("Connection is " + conn.getCallID() +
             ":" + conn.getDeviceID().getContent());
     System.out.println("Conn state is " + info[i].getLocalConnectionInfo());
 }
        Parameters:
        request - SnapshotCall object that contains a ConnectionID on the call for which the device information is desired.
        Returns:
        SnapshotCallResponse object containing the information about all devices / connections on the call.
        Throws:
        InvalidConnectionIDException - Thrown if the ConnectionID in the request is not valid. The call may have ended.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • snapshotDevice

        SnapshotDeviceResponse snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice request)
                               throws CstaException
        Provides information about calls associated with a given device. The information provided identifies each call the device is participating in and the local connection state of the device in that call. The ConnectionIDs found in the response are useful as parameters to SnapshotCall and SingleStepConferenceCall requests. The following code example shows how to use SnapshotDevice. 

         SnapshotDevice snapReq= new SnapshotDevice();
 snapReq.setSnapshotObject(id);
 SnapshotDeviceResponse snapResp = snapSvcs.snapshotDevice(snapReq);
 SnapshotDeviceResponseInfo [] info =
         snapResp.getCrossRefIDorSnapshotDeviceData().
         getSnapshotDeviceData().getSnapshotDeviceResponseInfo();
         
 for (int i = 0; i < info.length; i++) {
     ConnectionID conn = info[i].getConnectionIdentifier();
     System.out.println("Connection is " + conn.getCallID() +
             ":" + conn.getDeviceID().getContent());
     LocalConnectionState [] connStates = info[i].getLocalCallState().getCompoundCallState().getLocalConnectionState();
     for (int j = 0; j < connStates.length; j++) {
         System.out.println("Conn state is " + connStates[j]);
     }
 }
        Parameters:
        request - SnapshotDevice object that contains the DeviceID for which call information is desired.
        Returns:
        SnapshotDeviceResponse object containing the information about all calls on the device.
        Throws:
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if the DeviceID in the request is not valid. The device must be reigstered.
        PrivilegeViolationSpecifiedDeviceException - Thrown if the user does not have sufficient privileges to monitor the given device.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.
